headline: Pennsylvania’s gubernatorial race turns nasty as candidate Corman demands criminal investigation of rival Mastriano
author: Alex Henderson
sentences:

Wallen alleged Mastriano ‘may have committed flagrant and willful violations’ of state law by ‘submitting an obviously deficient and incomplete campaign finance report.’ The Corman campaign also sent the letter to state Attorney General Josh Shapiro, a Democrat who is also running for governor.”

Corman now finds himself at odds with Franklin County District Attorney Matthew Fogal, who is calling Corman’s demand for a criminal investigation of Mastriano “frivolous” and “shameful,” according to Philadelphia Inquirer reporter Andrew Seidman.
One of Mastriano’s foes has been Pennsylvania State Senate President Pro Tempore Jake Corman, a fellow Republican who is competing with Mastriano in Pennsylvania’s 2022 GOP gubernatorial primary.
In Pennsylvania, far-right State Sen. Doug Mastriano has been a vocal promoter of the Big Lie and former President Donald Trump’s bogus election fraud claims.
In an official statement on February 25, Fogal said, “This is a political stunt, and I have more important work to do for the citizens of Franklin County.
